message:
The orders to close the Al Jazeera channel in Israel were extended by 45 days.

Communications Minister Karhi signed the extension of the orders against the Al Jazeera channel for another 45 days. This decision was unanimously adopted by the government, based on updated opinions from all security sources, which state unequivocally that the channel's broadcasts constitute a real threat to the security of the state.
event_breakdown: Minister of Interior signed an order to extend the closure of the Al Jazeera channel in Israel for another 45 days.

message:
IDF Spokesperson: Following the sirens that sounded at 12:15 regarding a hostile aircraft infiltration in northern Israel, two UAVs were identified crossing from Lebanon. The UAVs fell in the area of the northern Golan Heights. No injuries were reported. The incident is under review. As a result of the UAV attacks, fires were ignited in the area. Israel Fire and Rescue Services are currently operating at the scene to extinguish the fires.  

Following the sirens that sounded at 12:07 regarding rocket and missile fire in northern Israel, approximately ten projectiles were identified crossing from Lebanon. The projectiles fell in open areas in the area of Zaura, igniting fires in the area. No injuries were reported. The IDF struck the sources of the launches.

message:
A photo sent to me by the follower R. in which we see Sergeant Saif Bisan who was killed in battle in the Gaza Strip on April 9, 2008. In an operation of the "Egoz" unit in the south of the Gaza Strip, near the Kissufim crossing, together with his friend Arnon Zamora, who was killed yesterday in the operation to rescue the hostages. Arnon is the one with the big smile on the right side of the picture.

Sometime during their course in 2005.
2 heroes.
event_breakdown: Sergeant Saif Bisan and Arnon Zamora were both members of the Egoz unit of the Israel Defense Forces (IDF). They were killed during an operation in the Gaza Strip on April 9, 2008, near the Kissufim crossing. Arnon Zamora was also killed during a hostage rescue operation in the Israeli city of Bnei Brak on March 30, 2022.

This comes amid reports that Israel has been conducting airstrikes on Hamas targets in Gaza in response to the rocket attacks.

The Iron Dome is designed to intercept and destroy short-range rockets and artillery shells fired into Israel.

message:
The "hot" story of Saturday for the Palestinians in the West Bank was not the release of the abductees in Nuseirat...

What drew a lot of interest on social networks was a video of a swimming pool in Ramallah (probably in one of the villas) in which mixed swimming was observed between men and women in swimwear, in a style that is not usually the first choice for Muslim women...

Many complaints reached the PA police, who dispatched their officers to the scene and closed the pool due to "violation of morals".

Gazans, for their part, lamented that while they are counting more than 200 dead in Nuseirat, their brothers (and sisters) in the West Bank are spending time at pool parties...

message: The Palestinians on social media are angry about the celebrations and fireworks in Jordan yesterday on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the coronation of Abdullah the King of Jordan, while they are counting their dead in Nuseirat following the operation to rescue the kidnapped.
event_breakdown:
Target event is a news push that reports an event that is happening in the current time frame and belongs to the category security, and not a past event.
Jordanian King Celebrates 25 Years on the Throne

In Jordan, King Abdullah celebrated his silver jubilee on the throne, which has caused tension between him and the Palestinian population. The Palestinians are enraged over the fact that Abdullah has aggressively expanded his power in recent years, and they are hardly justified in celebrating Abdullah’s achievements. Jordanian officials were criticized for not considering the wishes of the Palestinian population during their plans for the king’s celebrations. Most of the Palestinian population in Jordan are descendants of refugees forced to flee their country in 1948. Palestinians also feel that Abdullah is weak in standing up to Israel, the country that took over much of the land that was supposed to be the Palestinian homeland.

The Israeli-Palestinian conflict, which is at the root of many disputes in the Middle East, is a major source of tension and discord in the region.

After a visit to the World Expo in Milan, Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte headed back to the Philippines and arrived in Marawi on Friday. It is his first visit since the battle of Marawi ended with a Liberation of Marawi on October 17, 2017.

message:
IDF spokesperson:

After inspections by the IDF and Shin Bet, it can be confirmed that Abdallah al-Jamal was a Hamas operative who held the abductees Almog Meir, Andrey Kozlov and Shlomi Ziv in his family home in Nuseirat.

The hostages were held in the same house his family members lived in. This is further proof that the terrorist organization Hamas uses civilians as a human shield.

Israeli security forces will continue making all efforts necessary for the return of the hostages.
event_breakdown:
IDF Spokesperson: Hamas Operative Held Hostages in Nuseirat

The IDF Spokesperson announced that Abdallah al-Jamal, a Hamas operative, had abducted Israeli citizens Almog Meir, Andrey Kozlov and Shlomi Ziv. The three hostages were held in al-Jamal's family home in Nuseirat. The IDF and Shin Bet carried out inspections to confirm the information and revealed that the hostages were being held in the same house as al-Jamal's family members, proof that the terrorist group Hamas uses civilians as human shields. The Israeli security forces will continue their efforts to return the hostages.

message: Marie Le Pen following Macron's announcement of elections in France: We are ready to take power in France.
event_breakdown:
Marine Le Pen, the leader of France's far-right National Rally party, said today that her party "is ready to take power" in the European country following incumbent President Emmanuel Macron's official announcement that he is planning to stand for reelection.

Le Pen added that the National Rally party will now focus on winning the upcoming parliamentary election, which is scheduled to take place on June 12 and 19. Le Pen herself ran for president as recently as 2017, but lost to Macron and during his term in office he has sought to reform the French labour and pension system. She vowed to get rid of a tax he introduced that hits pensioners.

"The Emmanuel Macron project has failed," she said today. "There is no reason for him to be there any longer," she said, referring to Macron's persistent popularity ratings, which are often lower than his own.

"Marine Le Pen and her National Rally, who are today the only party in France, are ready to take power and become is clear once again," added the far-right leader.
Le Pen's claim that the National Rally is the only party in France is far from true. Just two weeks ago the far-right candidate Vincent Peillon, half-brother of the socialist presidential candidate Jean-Luc Mélenchon, was successful in his bid to stand as a National Rally candidate on a Paris list.

message:
An updated look of the Rafah crossing.

Palestinians are wondering what happened to this once busy port of entry.
event_breakdown: The Rafah crossing, once a busy port of entry for Palestinians, has been largely shut down since 2007. The only people allowed through the crossing are those who have special permits, such as medical patients and students. The crossing is now heavily guarded by the Egyptian military, and it is unclear when and if it will reopen.

message:
Middle Eastern channels are heavily covering Benny Gantz's announcement this evening, in which the Israeli minister announced his leaving of the war cabinet and coalition government.

The Iranian Tasnim News Agency chose the following hashtag for the announcement: "IsraelHasFallen."

##
Dramatic...
event_breakdown:
Benny Gantz, an Israeli politician and former Israel Defense Forces (IDF) Chief of Staff who has served as a member of the Knesset since 2013, announced that he was resigning from the war cabinet and coalition government on 20 April 2022, citing a lack of confidence in the current military strategy. The unexpected move sent shockwaves through the Israeli government and armed forces.
The Iranian Tasnim News Agency announced the news on 20 April 2022. Its headline read, "Benny Gantz Resigns from Benjamin Netanyahu's War Cabinet, Citing Lack of Confidence in Israeli Military Strategy."
A spokesperson for the government of Iran welcomed Gantz's resignation saying "the Israeli coalition government led by IsraelHasFallen Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is in free fall," and that "Israeli society is not united behind the government in what is increasingly looking like a dangerous and costly adventure for Israel."
The news was quickly picked up by major international media outlets, including the BBC and Al Jazeera, who reported that Gantz's resignation had left the coalition government in disarray.
